title: 'I was scammed by a rescue': Young mom rescues two stray kittens, receives "free" help from a local rescue to get them fixed, only for them to send her a bill she can’t afford
description: It's Meownday, feline fam, and we're already confused. Our questionable query is this: why does helping someone cost so much money? Shouldn't there be some sort of charity discount? We think that should be a thing. Anyway, we digress. It's just a shame that so many people go out of their way, spend thousands of their own dollars on saving animals in need, and get nothing back except for the good, fuzzy feelings in their hearts. Don't get us wrong, that's great, but maybe it should cost less to save a life in need.When the young mom in this post rescued two stray kittens, she posted about needing help to get them fixed. She specifically stated that she couldn't afford it, so when a local rescue came forward and offered to help, she assumed it would be for free. Well, fast forward a bit, and she gets a bill for her "free" help. Hence, why we think the charity discount should be a thing. Anyway, scroll down to read the full story below!
author: Blake Seidel
excerpt: 'I was scammed by a rescue': Young mom rescues two stray kittens, receives "free" help from a local rescue to get them fixed, only for them to send her a bill she can’t afford - World's largest collection of cat memes and other animals
text: If she has written proof that they never confirmed a price, then we think she's in the clear. However, we're not a lawyer, so don't take any legal advice from us. But it sounds like we're not really getting the full story here. Just our feline intuition. On the other hand, we've never heard of anyone doing anything for free. Everything has a price, even if it's not physical money. In this case, though, the price apparently is money. Money that was never spoken about. Or requested…until after the fact.
